Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large, and one scrawled line of red pigment.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393272) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393272)
